d54d1a481fe5dea0: Fe-X An estimated 16 million Americans have some degree of iron overload, either inherited (hemochromatosis) or acquired. Hereditary hemochromatosis (primary iron overload) is found more commonly in Northern Europeans, and some Southern Europeans. Secondary iron overload is acquired through the administration of recurrent blood transfusions (often for patients with thalassemia or sickle cell anemia); it is also possible to take too much oral supplementation. Iron is a free radical former, and excess iron can be toxic. Early symptoms of iron poisoning may include stomach pain, nausea, and vomiting. Excess iron is deposited mainly in the liver, heart, and endocrine organs. Excess iron in the liver can result in chronic liver disease, cirrhosis, and lead to hepatocellular carcinoma. In the heart muscle, it can lead to heart failure and irregular heart rhythms. Damage to the pancreas can lead to elevated blood glucose levels and "bronze" diabetes. Hypothyroidism and hypogonadism can result in fatigue, hair loss, infertility, and decreased libido. Joint involvement leads to arthritis. Iron deposits can accelerate neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer’s disease. Medical treatment for hereditary hemochromatosis consists of decreasing iron by the regular removal of blood from the body. The condition is generally monitored by serum ferritin or transferrin levels, but there is a better test. The gold standard for iron overload is a percent of iron saturation over 50 percent and this can also be true for hemochromatosis. Multiply the total serum iron by 100 and dividing the result by the total iron binding capacity (TIBC). If the value is greater than 50%, iron overload is present. Fe-X contains inositol hexaphosphate, which studies have shown to be effective at removing iron8,9,10. Be aware that it also chelates other minerals, so an iron-free multimineral needs to be taken with this product. It contains zinc, which can inhibit iron bioavailability1,2,3,4. It has molybdenum which, interestingly enough, offsets iron overload as well as benefiting anemia patients7,8. This, because of its relationship with copper. Cilantro, along with its chelating ability has been shown to protect against liver ischemia and cell damage11,12. During a clinical trial,18 out of 25 completed the six-week study using Fe-X and an iron free multiple mineral formula. The Fe-X with the iron fee multiple mineral formula was over 90 percent effective in lowering serum iron and percent of saturation. Only one of the 18 patients who completed the study was diagnosed with hemochromatosis. If the percent of saturation does not come down below 50 after 45 days on the program, the patient should be referred for gene testing to identify hemochromatosis (two or three gene positive). It is frequently inherited and is silent killer therefore, all the 1st degree relatives should be tested to rule out hemochromatosis. The treatment period for using Fe-X for secondary iron overload is 45 days. In hereditary hemochromatosis, the treatment may need to be ongoing. The medical treatment is to remove blood, thus reducing iron levels. Fe-X may reduce the need for this procedure. The need for testing percent iron saturation will be ongoing, as is the supplementation. Fe-X Description: One serving (2 capsules) contains 50 mg of Zinc Picolinate and a 450 mg proprietary blend of Molybdenum Citrate, Inositol Hexaphosphate (IP6) and cilantro. Recommendations: 2 to 3 capsules, two times per day for 45 days or as otherwise directed by a health care professional. The iron free mineral formula should be used through the entire forty-five day program. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration have not evaluated statements made herein. Expanded Clinical Notes: Magnesium Orotate 1250 Magnesium orotate (Nieper orotate – originally called vitamin B-13), helps to support the heart’s ability to endure and recover from chronic and acute stress through the maintenance of normal glycogen stores, protein synthesis, ATP levels and contractile function. The U.S. manufactured Nieper magnesium orotate produced by Zorex International is fully reacted, unlike most orotates which are food-grade mixtures of orotic acid with inorganic magnesium salts, which may cause mild liver toxicity. Magnesium orotate (Nieper form as produced by Zorex International) also acts as a key intermediate in the biosynthesis of pyrimidine nucleo- tides which is a building block for your DNA code and for RNA. Dr. Nieper was, in some re- searcher’s minds, a “space cadet” because of his interest in theoretical physics; in fact his views on gravity and other forms of physics were viewed by many as nonsense. However, his true accomplishments were the outcome of his clinical work. With the help of various col- leagues he developed orotic acid as a mineral transporter. Nieper insisted that with most mineral carriers the carrier becomes trapped in the inner cell membrane and the mineral is not properly released. The orotates; however, pass through both the outer and inner cell membrane into the interior of the cell and only become metabolized once they reach the membranes of structures within the cell, thus leaving the ion in or near these structures and allowing a lower level of the elemental mineral to be used. While these explanations are soundly plausible, there is no peer literature to support his theories. However, as stated in the literature on the reverse side mail, there is peer reviewed literature supporting the use of his magnesium orotate with recovery from heart attacks, recovery from heart surgery, im- proved athletic performance, cardiovascular disease and elevated cholesterol. Nieper also used (as we did when it was previously available) magnesium orotate for atherosclerosis, renal failure from diabetes and/or hypertension, blood clots and although not previously mentioned, M.S. One last thought on the Nieper magnesium orotate – Ultimately the value of Nieper’s work on mineral transporters does not depend upon whether his theories and explanations were valid, or upon whether his observations were biased, or upon the rulings of the government or the medical cartel. It depends only upon whether the transporters work when you use them. Many users, past and present, are quite convinced that their lives or health and lives of their patients have been rescued by these supplements and this alone justifies their exist- ence in the healing arts. Pregnenolone Pregnenolone is a steroid precursor hormone produced principally in the adrenal glands, but also in the liver, skin, brain, testicles, ovaries, and retina of the eyes. Steroids are a large family of structurally similar biochemicals that have sex-determining, anti-inflammatory, and growth-regulatory roles. Indeed, pregnenolone is the grand precursor from which almost all of the other steroid hormones are made; including DHEA, progesterone, testosterone, the estrogens, and cortiso.. Despite its powerful metabolites, pregnenolone is acknowledged to be without significant side effects, with minimal or no anabolic, estrogenic or androgenic activity. Pregnenolone also operates as a powerful neurosteroid in the brain, modulating the transmission of messages from neuron to neuron and strongly influencing learning and memory processes.1,2 As with DHEA, pregnenolone levels natu- rally peak during youth and begin a long, slow decline with age. By the age of 75 our bodies produce 60% less pregne- nolone than the levels produced in our mid-thirties.3 For this reason pregnenolone is one of the biomarkers of aging. Like counting the rings of a tree, by measuring the level of pregnenolone at any given point of a person's life, it is often possible to make an educated guess as to his or her age. Some other hormones that decline with age are DHEA, estrogen, testosterone, and growth hormone.4 These are con- sidered biomarkers of aging as well. Since pregnenolone provides the initial raw material from which all the other steroid hormones are made, some of our other hormones will decline in a parallel fashion. While our youth-giving hormones are diminishing, loss of quality of life progressively settles in. We slowly begin to experience physical and mental decline; loss of energy, memory loss, visual and hearing impairment, arthritis, cardiovascular disease, and sexual decline, just to name a few. Supplementing small amounts of these neurohormones may slow these age-related processes, improving one's quality of life by rejuvenating the body to more youthful functioning. The best known example of hormone replacement therapy is estrogen replacement for menopausal women to prevent heart disease, osteoporosis, vaginal discomfort and many other conditions of menopause. More recent studies have shown that replacing growth hormone in elderly individuals can also produce age-reversing changes, including in- creased lean muscle mass, reduced fat, stronger bones, and thicker skin. Human studies were conducted in the 1940's on factory workers to test the effect of pregnenolone on anti-fatigability5,6,7 and autoimmune disorders,8 including rheumatoid arthritis. The results were successful and improvements were noted. Even though pregnenolone was proving to be not only effective, but safe as well, it was discarded when Merck's newly introduced pharmaceutical agent, cortisone, was announced to be a cure-all for rheumatoid arthritis in 1949.9 Soon after cortisone and cortisol came into use, the synthetic steroid hormones dexamethasone, and later prednisone, was introduced. Remember that these steroids are hundreds of times more powerful than pregnenolone (or DHEA for that matter). Because they could be patented, it was more politically and economically advantageous for pharmaceutical companies to promote these drugs rather than pregnenolone. Additionally, these steroids were very fast acting com- pared to pregnenolone. Users and doctors preferred the quick fix. However, these steroidal compounds proved to have (and still do have) serious downsides, including compromising the immune system and inducing osteoporosis, among other serious complications.

Pregnenolone Even though cortisone and cortisol are stress hormones which are natural to the body, they have historically been and continue to be administered in pharmacological doses rather than at physiological amounts natural to the body. The pharmacological levels at which cortisone and cortisol are generally administered give them a risk profile not unlike that of the synthetic hormones. Scientists have been studying the impact of hormones on learning and memory for many years. Dr. Eugene Roberts has been a leading figure in neurochemistry for more than half a century. He has been a primary figure in reviving interest in pregnenolone and DHEA as therapeutic agents. Regarding pregnenolone, Dr. Roberts has said, "Of all the things that have been tested anywhere in the brain, this is by far the most potent."10 Although many substances have been found to help maintain healthy cognitive function, pregnenolone seems to have extraordinary activity in this regard.11 Various studies have found that pregnenolone supports motivation, the ability to acquire knowledge, and long-term memory.12 One study found pregnenolone to be one hundred times more effective for memory support than other memory-promoting steroids.13 Other studies have revealed pregnenolone's ability to maintain learning function even when used in exceptionally small amounts.14 One of the most remarkable properties of pregnenolone is its apparent ability to support certain aspects of memory when taken "after the fact."15 This has been found to be true for DHEA also, but to a lesser degree. Thus, the use of pregnenolone may help recall of information encountered prior to ingestion. You may wake up in the morning, decide that you really want to embed information previously absorbed, and take some pregnenolone. A research group of industrial psychologists conducted studies in the 1940's to test pregnenolone on students and workers for the ability to enhance job performance.5-8 They found that the students/workers had a markedly improved ability to learn and remember difficult tasks. It is also amazing that pregnenolone not only enhanced job performance of the students/workers; but they additionally experienced heightened feelings of well-being. In the words of Dr .William Regelson, renowned oncologist, researcher and leading figure of the "super hormone" revolution puts it this way, "... this super hormone [pregnenolone] has the ability to make us not only smarter but happier."16 The same research group performed a study on factory workers to see if pregnenolone could improve their work productivity. Productivity increased most notably in the workers whose situations were considered the most stressful; for example, the workers who got paid per piece and whose living depended on their productivity. Improvement was noted, but less so, in workers who got paid a fixed wage regardless of their productivity levels. Not only did pregne- nolone improve productivity for both groups, but the workers reported enhanced mood. The insidious disappearance of well-being is a common experience for many of us as we age. The onset of depres- sion and energy loss is so universal for older and elderly people that it is written off as part of the normal aging pro- cess and left unattended. This is particularly unfortunate since there is something that can be done. We know that neurohormones affect neurotransmitters and can have profound effects on mental function. Many sci- entists and physicians believe depression in older people may be due to deficiency in the hormones that were once circulating at youthful concentrations. Restoring youthful levels of pregnenolone and possibly other neurohormones may prevent or even reverse age-related depression.

Pregnenolone In addition to a steady stream of anecdotal reports, there have been other experiments indicating pregnenolone's asso- ciation with elevated mood, increased energy, and alleviated or improved depression. If further studies solidify pregne- nolone's role, as well as the role of other neurosteroids, with regard to depression and other possible mood dysfunc- tions, it will further the natural hormone replacement revolution within the life extension arena and possibly bring about a total reformation in psychiatric medicine. Historically, pregnenolone has been used successfully for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis as far back as the 1940's. Studies were conducted to determine the effects of pregnenolone on other autoimmune disorders such as lupus and ankylosing spondylitis. Progesterone Cream (Micronized/Bio-Identical) According to Ray Peat, Ph.D., who is considered one of the world’s leading experts on natural progesterone therapy, “sixty years ago, progesterone was considered to be the main hormone produced by the ovaries since it was necessary for fertility and for maintaining a health pregnancy. It was called “pro-gestational hormone”, ad its name sometimes leads people to think that it isn’t needed when you do not want to get pregnant. In fact, it is the most protective hormone the body produces, and the large amounts that are produced during pregnancy result from the developing baby’s need for protection from the stressful environment. Normally, the brain contains a very high concentration of progesterone, reflecting its protective function for that important organ. The thymus gland, the key organ of our immune system, is also profoundly dependent on progesterone”. Another quote from one of Dr Peat’s summaries on natural progesterone “ Published experiments have shown that progesterone relieves anxiety, improves memory, protects brain cells and even prevents epileptic seizures. It promotes respiration and has been used to correct emphysema. In the circulatory sys-tem, it prevents bulging veins by increasing the tone of blood vessels and improves the efficiency of the heart. It reverses many of the signs of aging in the skin and promotes health bone growth”. C. Djerassi, The Making Of The Pill, Science. Djerassi indicated that until the middle 1920s it was assumed that progesterone’s biological activity was extremely specific and “any alteration of the molecule would diminish or abolish its activity”. This would discourage interest from big pharma who could not patent a natural substance. However, later the molecule was changed in order to allow big pharma to produce it. In Defense of Progesterone: A Review of the Literature, Lieberman and Curtis, Alternative Therapies in Health and Medicine. A meta-analysis of three studies involving 86.881 post-menopausal women reported that the use of natural progesterone was associated with significant lower risk of breast cancer compared with synthetic progestins. Anovulation and low levels of serum progesterone have been associated with a significantly higher risk of breast cancer in pre-menopausal women. Use of natural progesterone has been linked to lower rates of uterine and colon cancers and may also be useful in treating other cancers such as ovarian, melanoma, mesothelioma and prostate. Lieberman and Curtis concluded “Physicians should have no hesitation prescribing natural progesterone, as the evidence is clear that progesterone does not cause breast cancer. Indeed, progesterone is protective and preventative of breast cancer”. Unsuspecting Benzyl Alcohol Hypersensitivity, Grant and Associates, New England Journal of Medicine, When patients/clients indicate an allergy to progesterone, they are generally not aware of the presence of a toxic solvent such as benzyl alcohol. The Progesterone Cream produced by Zorex International contains no benzyl alcohol or other toxic substances. The ZRT Laboratory Blog, David Zava, Ph.D., Topical Progesterone, Not Synthetic Progestins or Oral Progesterone, Should be Considered as a Companion for Estradiol Replacement Therapy. This is a long article describing the value of natural topical progesterone. It is an extensive review of the literature on this subject and we encourage you to find it on the internet and read the factual information. Stephenson and Associates, Topical Progesterone Cream Does Not Increase Thrombotic and Inflammatory Factors in Post-Menopausal Women, Blood. Post-menopausal women have an increased risk of cardiovascular disease, and heart disease is the leading cause of death in post-menopausal American women. In this prospective blinded study the authors examined the short-term effect of topical progesterone cream on menopausal symptom relief in 30 healthy post-menopausal women; to determine the potential adverse effects of topical progesterone cream on hemostatic and inflammatory factors and cortisol levels. Subjects were randomized to receive topical progesterone cream or placebo for four weeks, followed by a four week wash out period. After the wash out period the subjects crossed over to either placebo cream or active cream for four weeks. From this study the authors conclude that administration of topical progesterone cream significantly relieves menopausal symptoms in post-menopausal women without adversely altering pro-thrombotic potential. The authors further concluded that the thrombotic complications observed with progesterone drug therapy do not occur with topical progesterone cream. This treatment should be seriously considered as an effective and safe alternative clinical therapy for women suffering from post- menopausal symptoms. Low testosterone can lead to more serious health problems. It is linked to obesity and increased abdominal fat, Alzheimer’s disease18, diabetes (33% of type 2 diabetics have low testosterone20), and heart disease16,17. The thing you really notice in men with low testosterone levels is a lack of initiative—they fit the stay‐at‐home, couch‐ potato stereotype. They may say things like, “I used to like to work on the car (go on a hike, go dancing, work around the yard, etc.), but I really don’t feel like doing that anymore.” Women can have low testosterone as well. Levels decline between the ages of 20 and 40. In women low testosterone is linked to a decrease in libido, as well as the other symptoms experienced by men. One of the ingredients in TomKat, Tribulus terrestis, has been shown to increase libido in premenopausal women8. Each serving (four capsules) of TomKat contains a 2580 mg proprietary blend of Indonesian Tongkat Ali E(urycoma longifolia Root Extract), Chinese Red Ginseng, Horny Goat Weed Extract E(pimedium ), Korean Red Ginseng Root P(anax ginseng ), Tribulus terrestis extract, and Maca L(epidium ). Eurycoma longifolia is well studied and has been shown to increase testosterone levels, increase muscle mass, improve sperm counts, improve erectile dysfunction, and treat osteoporosis1,2,3,4,5. Red Ginseng reduces obesity and improves fat metabolism, even in the absence of testosterone. It also improves erectile dysfunction6,7 . Tribulus terrestis has been shown to improve erectile dysfunction, improve sperm quality, and even improve libido in premenopausal women8,9,10 . Epimedium has been shown to improve erectile dysfunction11,13,14. Maca improves sperm count and quality, as well as libido12,14,15. Clinical research as well as citations from the peer reviewed literature (available on request) has shown the botanicals used in TomKat to be safe and effective for the following: Increased immune system function, reduction in allergic responses, increased stamina, increased sex drive, increased athletic performance, and / or Increased growth and repair of muscle tissue. Recommendations: Four capsules in the a.m. or as otherwise directed by a health care professional. Consideration should be given to using TomKat with Liposomal/DIM Chrysin (combines DIM and Chrysin in a liposome for sublingual absorption) to help prevent the conversion of testosterone to estrogen through the aromatase pathway (a common problem with botanicals/supplements that increase testosterone). Cautions: TomKat should not be used during pregnancy or lactation or by males or females with a history of cancer. Further, it should not be used by males with an increased PSA or by athletes subject to testing for steroids. P.O. 69032a6a2bfc5ad7: Zinc Orotate Zinc deficiency causes slow growth in infants and children, delayed sexual development in adolescents and impotence in men. Zinc deficiency also causes hair loss, diarrhea, eye and skin sores and loss of appetite. Weight loss, problems with wound healing, decreased ability to taste food, and lower alertness levels can also occur. Supplemental zinc has been used to improve the immune system1,2(deficiency is associated with atrophy of the thymus, reduction in white blood cell counts, and increased susceptibility to infection9,10), improve cognition3, wound healing4,5, and improvement in the ability to taste or smell8. Zinc deficiency has been implicated in age-related osteoporosis11, and zinc supplements can speed the healing of fractures in animal models12. Another important role for zinc is in maintaining male reproductive function. Deficiency of zinc is associated with hypogonadism and low levels of serum testosterone (reversible upon supplementation13). It helps with sexual performance6 and sperm quality7. Zinc also appears to be important for the activity of growth hormone (GH) since GH loses effectiveness under conditions of zinc deficiency14 . Why Zinc Orotate? Orotates are the mineral salts of orotic acid, a natural substance found in our bodies and also in various foods including dairy products. Dr. Hans Neiper, a rather controversial figure, postulated that minerals bound to orotates are more easily transported through cell membranes than other forms. Orotate salts are more electrically neutral than other mineral salts and are therefore more lipophilic, making them easier to be transported through the cell membrane (which has two lipid layers). Orotic acid (OA) was once considered to be a vitamin (B13). Although orotic acid isn’t officially considered a vitamin these days, over 40 years ago it was found to have growth-promoting, vitamin-like properties when added to the diets of laboratory animals. Subsequent nutritional studies in humans and animals revealed that OA has a “sparing” effect on vitamin B12, meaning that supplemental OA can partially compensate for B12 deficiency. OA also appears to have a direct effect on folate metabolism. Zinc orotate stabilizes blood glucose and reduces the need for insulin in diabetics, according to Dr. Nieper15. In addition, zinc orotate and other zinc compounds synergize with sulfur-containing antioxidants (sulfhydryls) to protect against free radical-induced tissue injury16,17,a result which may have relevance to the treatment of diabetes as well as other diseases of increased oxidative stress18. Dr. Neiper is a controversial figure, but he is not the only researcher to look into orotates. The value of orotates and orotic acid have, however, been studied by other researchers and found to be of value. Magnesium orotate, for example, has been extensively studied for its cardiac benefits. Orotate and orotic acid have been found to be cardioprotective, even without the magnesium19,20,21,22,23. Carnitine orotate has been found to improve glucose metabolism and fatty liver24,25. In general, orotic acid protects the liver26. Orotates and orotic acid have been studied and found to improve memory and cognition in animal studies27,28. Zi nc Orotate: Each capsule contains 94 mg of fully reacted zinc orotate providing 15 mg of elemental zinc. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has not evaluated statements made herein. 66a097798f68d369: GB Complete (Gall Bladder/Liver Complete) The liver should produce between one and one‐and‐a‐half quarts of bile per day. Small changes in liver and gallbladder function will gradually lower the amount of bile production and lead to biliary stasis. This is especially true of patients who eat a highly refined diet. If biliary stasis is present, the amount of bile produced by the liver decreases. The bile becomes thick and sluggish. If left untreated, bile can back up and cause further damage to the liver. Biliary stasis can also lead to the formation of gallstones. Poor bile production causes poor absorption of essential fatty acids and fat‐soluble nutrients (vitamins A, D, E, and K). The earliest symptom is usually itching. Pain (upper right quadrant, right shoulder or between the shoulder blades), varicosities and spider veins, dry or flaking skin, skin peeling at the heels, deficiencies in oil‐soluble nutri-ents, constipation, and even GERD (gastric reflux) can be the result of biliary stasis. Sometimes the stools will con-tain fat or be clay colored. Other subjective indications include pain over the eyes, pain when pressure is applied to the webbing between the right thumb and forefinger, and pain between the shoulder blades. Biliary stasis is quite common in patients with insulin insensitivity. Approximately 30% of American adults are insulin insensitive and 25% have Syndrome X. The components of GB Complete are designed to thin bile, improve hepatic function, address fatty liver, and even prevent and disrupt gallstone formation. The components of GB Complete include two capsules contain 25mg of vitamin C (as ascorbic acid), 850 mg proprietary blend: of Artichoke extract, Fenugreek seed extract, L‐Taurine, phosphatidylcholine, and Phyllanthus niruri). Science backs the use of GB Complete. the history of artichoke is a perfect example of science finally catching up to the longstanding traditional uses of a medicinal plant. It has traditionally been used for gallstones, to support liver function, and as a liver and gallbladder bile stimulant1, 2, 3, 4, 5. Artichoke extract can increase bile production in patients with biliary stasis 1. The use of artichoke extract avoids the use of beets for patients who have been diag-nosed with oxalate calculi. Other constituents of GB Complete include taurine, which has been shown to inhibit gallstone formation14 and phos- phatidylcholine. Phosphatidylcholine alleviates fatty liver15. Interference with the production of phosphatidylcholine can lead to cholestasis16. Description: Two capsules contain 25mg of vitamin C (as ascorbic acid), 850 mg proprietary blend: of Artichoke extract, Fenugreek seed extract, L‐Taurine, phosphatidylcholine, Phyllanthus niruri. Recommendations: 2‐4 capsules, 3 times a day with meals or as directed by a health care professional. P.O. USP Estriol will provide most of the benefits without the risks associated with stronger estrogens. The immediate precursors to estriol are androstenedione or testosterone. Evidence exists that USP estriol has potential benefits for many autoimmune problems. It has also been used successfully with Vaginal dryness, pain with sex, PMS, other menopausal symptoms (use with Bio-Identical Natural Micronize Progesterone Cream), osteoporosis, increased blood pressure (use with Arginine Complex), increased blood lipids and vascular disease (use with CircuPlus). While conventional estrogen replacement therapy provides some benefits when a need can be determined through bio-assay, it is not without certain risks that are not present with USP estriol. Availability and Application: Bio-Identical/Natural USP Micronized Estrogen Cream is available in 3 ounce contains (60 full pumps per container). 4bc3db3c36f2ead4: QUERCETIN Description: Each capsule contains 500 mg of Quercetin, 100 mg of Bromelain and 100 mg of Rutin. Quercetin is a flavonoid belonging to a group of polyphenolic compounds that are produced exclusively in plants (citrus fruit and onions primarily). Rutin is sourced from buckwheat, and several fruits. Zorex International uses onions for quercetin and buckwheat for rutin. Clinical Considerations: Quercetin helps to block the sorbitol pathway (entry into the nerve cells, kidneys, and eyes), tissues where excess glucose causes damage, and failure with uncontrolled diabetes (In vitro and in vivo evidence that quercetin protects against diabetes and its complications: A systemic review of the literature, Jang-Shi and Associates, China Pharmaceutical University). Quercetin can reduce inflammation by scavenging free radicals. Inflammation is always increased in patients with acute and chronic disease, most especially viral, and bacterial infection (A Review of Flavonoid Quercetin: Metabolism, Bioactivity and Antioxidant Properties, Alrawaiq and Abdullah, Department of Pharmacology, Kebangsaan University, Malaysia). It has been demonstrated that quercetin has ability to help transport zinc into the cell with viral infection, (Eidenier, Jamieson, Furda and Associates, Biochemical Blood Biopsy). Quercetin will help to inhibit testosterone to estrogen conversion through the aromatase pathway, Inhibition of estrogen in human liver microsomes by quercetin and other flavonoids, (Huang and Associates, Department of Environmental Health, University of New York at Albany, New York, USA). Quercetin is a well-known and clinically established antihistamine, (Quercetin and its Anti-Allergic Immune Response, Micek and Associates, Molecules). Like zinc, rutin is a natural cofactor to quercetin. It is effective as a cancer protective agent, antioxidant, anti- inflammatory, has been found to be effective with autism, viral and bacterial infections, hemorrhoids, most skin conditions, and spider veins, (The Beneficial Role of Rutin, A Natural Occurring Flavonoid in Health and Disease Prevention, Patel and Associates, Science Direct). Conclusion: Quercetin and Rutin have been shown to be effective adjunctive treatment for systemic inflammation, as an aromatase inhibitor, as a natural means of limiting glucose into the eyes, nerves, and kidneys for patients with diabetes, as adjunctive support with viral and other infections, as a natural antihistamine and a known transport agent for zinc. Availability: Quercetin is available in 120 capsule bottles. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration have not evaluated statements made herein. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat or prevent disease.

88ed1b141d58cb30: KI Caps (Potassium Iodide) Description: Each capsule of KI Caps contains 5 mg of vitamin B2 (as riboflavin 5’ Phosphate), 12.5 mg of iodine (as potassium iodide), 200 mcg of Selenomethionine and 100 mg of L-Tyrosine. Special Note: Selenomethionine was included in the KI Caps because more than 80% of T-3 is produced peripherally by the removal of iodine from the 5’ position of T-4 (deiodination). This process occurs via a selenoprotein called 5’de-iodinase which has selenomethionine in its active site. Selenomethionine should always be used with iodine, hence its inclusion in KI Caps. A summary paper on iodine for breast and whole health is available upon request. Clinical Considerations: According to the peer reviewed literature, iodine is antibacterial, anti-neoplastic, anti-parasitic, antiviral, increases pH and serves as a mucolytic agent. KI-Caps should be considered for fibrocystic breast disease, acne, parotid stones, prostate problems, ovarian and uterine problems, intercostal neuralgia, atherosclerosis, headaches (use with Celtic Sea salt), depression, cracks in the skin on the hands or feet, thyroid hypo and hyperfunction and Hashimoto’s. Also, with Hashimoto’s, the patient should be checked via a secretory IgA to ascertain gut immunity. Decreased gut immunity is common with Hashimoto’s as is sensitivity to gluten. KI Caps should only be used while under the direct supervision of a health care professional. Urinary iodine excretion testing should always be employed to determine short and long-term iodine needs. High dose iodine (more than 12.5 mg a day) is usually well tolerated by most people, however some people with iodine sensitivity, Hashimoto’s, goiter (Riboflavin 5’- Phosphate is added to KI-Caps to help prevent goiter) do not tolerate iodine well. KI-Caps are contraindicated with iodine induced thyroid hypofunction, thyroid cancer and iodism (metallic taste in the mouth). KI-Caps should be considered at 1 capsule daily and increased/decreased as determined by urinary iodine excretion testing. In some cases, niacin is needed as a co-factor to iodine and with these cases Niacin 250 should also be considered at one per day. Recommendations: 2 capsules per day or as otherwise directed by a health care professional. Availability: KI Caps are available in 90 capsule bottles. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration have not evaluated statements made herein. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat or prevent disease.

The supplement ingredients you've listed are beneficial for various aspects of health, particularly for thyroid function and overall metabolic health. Here's a breakdown of each component, its form, dosage, and health benefits: 1. Vitamin B2 (Riboflavin 5’ Phosphate) - 5 mg Form: Riboflavin 5' Phosphate is the active form of Vitamin B2. It is more readily utilized by the body compared to standard riboflavin. Health Benefits: Energy Production: Assists in the breakdown of carbohydrates, proteins, and fats to produce energy. Antioxidant Protection: Helps in the regeneration of other antioxidants such as glutathione. Skin and Eye Health: Important for maintaining healthy skin and vision. Nervous System: Supports the nervous system’s health by facilitating nerve communication. 2. Iodine (as Potassium Iodide) - 12.5 mg Form: Potassium Iodide is a common form of iodine used in dietary supplements, readily absorbed by the body. Health Benefits: Thyroid Function: Essential for the synthesis of thyroid hormones, which regulate metabolism, growth, and development. Cognitive Function: Adequate iodine is crucial during pregnancy and infancy for proper brain development. Metabolic Enhancer: Helps in maintaining a healthy metabolic rate. 3. Selenomethionine - 200 mcg Form: Selenomethionine is an organic form of selenium that is better absorbed and utilized than other forms like sodium selenite. Health Benefits: Antioxidant Defense: Plays a critical role in the body’s antioxidant systems that protect cells from damage. Thyroid Health: Essential for the conversion of thyroid hormones from their inactive to active forms. Immune Function: Supports immune health by fostering immune cell function and response. 4. L-Tyrosine - 100 mg Form: L-Tyrosine is an amino acid that serves as a building block for several important brain chemicals (neurotransmitters), including epinephrine, norepinephrine, and dopamine. Health Benefits: Neurotransmitter Production: Helps in the synthesis of neurotransmitters that affect mood, stress response, and mental function. Cognitive and Mental Health: Supports cognitive function under conditions of stress and mental strain. Thyroid Hormones: Precursor to the thyroid hormones thyroxine and triiodothyronine, and thereby supports thyroid function. d003cffdfe7e7e98: Phosphatidylcholine Description: Each capsule of Phosphatidylcholine from Zorex International contains 1200 mg of phosphatidylcholine complex, which provides 420 mg of phosphatidylcholine. It also contains other phospholipids, including phosphatidylserine, phosphatidylinositol, and phosphatidylethanolamine. Consider it for conditions where the health of the cell membrane matter. Some practitioners consider it vital to any detoxification regimen. It keeps toxins from clinging to cell membranes (especially in the nervous system). The choline combination indicated is useful for the health of brain tissue, nerve tissue, the microbiome, lung tissue, hepatic tissue, and other mammalian cells in the body. Further, patients with decreased levels of choline are at great risk to liver cirrhosis and fatty liver cirrhosis. Clinical Conditions: Think of the structure of phosphatidylcholine (PC) as a choline head, a glycerol body and two fatty acid legs. The architecture of phosphatidylcholine parallels that of the cell membrane. It is accepted by the membrane as a building block, incorporating itself into the cell’s structure. It is taken to enhance the health of cell membranes. Since the structure of PC contains fatty acids, the quality of the fatty acids consumed matters1,2. When supplementing with PC, make sure that the patient is consuming good fats in the diet; you may also consider giving a good fatty acid supplement, like SunFlax Complex. One of the best researched use of phosphatidylcholine is in ameliorating liver damage. There are many studies that show its benefit for patients with both alcoholic and non-alcoholic fatty liver3,4,5,6,7. PC use in both hepatitis B and hepatitis C has been studied and found to have a positive effect8,9,10,11. When you think of phosphatidylcholine, think of cellular repair. Inflammatory bowel disease is all about damage to the cells lining the intestine, and patients can benefit from PC supplementation. Studies have shown that PC supplementation is extremely helpful to patients with ulcerative colitis12,13,14,15. You may consider it for your patients with leaky gut. PC is good to give to patients taking NSAIDs. Studies show that PC can reduce the damage done to the GI tract by these drugs16,17. The brain and nervous system have a high content of lipids and phospholipids. PC may be valuable for long-term health of the brain and nervous system. It may be possible to slow the progression of dementia by replenishing the phospholipids in the brain. There are studies that show the benefits of phosphatidylcholine supplementation to the nervous system. PC is useful for the health of the brain tissue itself. Higher phosphatidylcholine levels were associated with thicker grey matter in the prefrontal cortex and with cognitive flexibility18. Animal studies have shown that PC supplementation protects the brain from dementia and even improves memory.19,20 PC may also be beneficial to patients with asthma. Inhalation of nanoparticles of PC improved lung function tests in asthmatics, according to one study21. Another study found that a combination of PC and iodine was also found to be effective in relieving the symptoms of patients with childhood asthma22. In general, this combination seems to benefit patients with allergies23,24. Recommendations: With Liver cirrhosis or fatty liver product should be dosed at 6-7 tid, with other conditions 1-2 tid and in either case it should be used with GB Complete and E.N.V./GBLV Homeopathic. Availability: Product is available in 210 capsule bottles. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration have not evaluated statements made herein.
